Module com.example.sudokuproject
Package com.example.sudokuproject.model

Class SudokuGameModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudokuproject.model.NumberGenerator
com.example.sudokuproject.model.WelcomeSudokuModel
com.example.sudokuproject.model.SudokuGameModel
public class SudokuGameModel extends WelcomeSudokuModel
SudokuGameModel extends WelcomeSudokuModel and adds functionality for validating numbers and generating suggestions for the Sudoku game. This model is responsible for validating user input, ensuring that only valid numbers are placed in the Sudoku grid, and providing suggestions when needed.
Author:
Mateo Noguera Pinto

  • Method Details

    • getBoardToShow

      public int[][] getBoardToShow()
      Removes the necessary numbers from the solved board and returns the result
      Returns:
      int[][] : the board ready to be shown

    • generateBoard

      public boolean generateBoard()
      Fills the board with random numbers while ensuring that each number satisfies the Sudoku rules (no duplicates in the same row, column, or block). If a valid configuration is found, it returns true. If a number cannot be placed in a cell, it goes back and tries other numbers.
      Returns:
      true if the board is successfully generated, false otherwise.

    • getRandomNumbers

      private List<Integer> getRandomNumbers()
      Generates a shuffled list of numbers from 1 to the board size. This ensures randomness in the Sudoku board generation.
      Returns:
      a shuffled List of integers from 1 to SIZE.

    • isValidChar

      public boolean isValidChar(char letter)
      Validates if the provided character is a valid digit for the game. A valid digit is between 1 and 6.
      Parameters:
      letter - The character to be validated.
      Returns:
      True if the character is a valid digit between 1 and 6, false otherwise.

    • isValidNumber

      private boolean isValidNumber(int num, int row, int col)
      Checks if a given number is valid in a specific cell of the Sudoku board. The number is valid if it does not appear in the same row, column, or 2x3 block as the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      num - the number to check.
      row - the row index of the cell to check.
      col - the column index of the cell to check.
      Returns:
      true if the number is valid in the specified cell, false otherwise.

    • removeNumbers

      public void removeNumbers(int fromRow, int fromCol)
      Removes 4 random numbers from a specific 2x3 block of the Sudoku board. The method ensures that exactly 4 cells are cleared (set to 0) within the block defined by the starting row and column.
      Parameters:
      fromRow - the starting row of the 2x3 block.
      fromCol - the starting column of the 2x3 block.

    • existsWinner

      public boolean existsWinner(int[][] board)
      Compares the board passed with the solved one
      Parameters:
      board - a matrix representing the current board of the user
      Returns:

    • isValidNumber

      public boolean isValidNumber(int number, ArrayList<Integer> colNums, ArrayList<Integer> rowNums, ArrayList<Integer> blockNums)
      Checks if a given number is valid based on the provided lists of numbers in the same row, column, and block. The number is valid if it does not appear in any of these lists.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to check.
      colNums - the list of numbers present in the column.
      rowNums - the list of numbers present in the row.
      blockNums - the list of numbers present in the 2x3 block.
      Returns:
      true if the number is valid, false if it is already present in one of the lists.

    • getSuggestion

      public int getSuggestion(ArrayList<Integer> numsInCol, ArrayList<Integer> numsInRow, ArrayList<Integer> numsInBlock) throws NoSuggestionFoundException
      Provides a valid suggestion for an empty cell based on the numbers already present in the same column, row, and block.
      Parameters:
      numsInCol - The list of numbers present in the column.
      numsInRow - The list of numbers present in the row.
      numsInBlock - The list of numbers present in the 2x3 block.
      Returns:
      A valid suggestion (number) that can be placed in the empty cell.
      Throws:
      NoSuggestionFoundException - If no valid suggestion can be found.
